thread.title: Idaho county reports doubling of concealed handgun licenses since Oregon college shooting
thread.title_full: Idaho county reports doubling of concealed handgun licenses since Oregon college shooting

author: The Associated Press
title: Idaho county reports doubling of concealed handgun licenses since Oregon college shooting
text:
Idaho county reports doubling of concealed handgun licenses since Oregon college shooting concealed weapons Professor Ann Cvetkovich waits to speak during a public forum as a committee studies how to implement a new Texas law allowing students with concealed weapons permits to carry firearms into classes and campus buildings. The law takes effect in August 2016. (Eric Gay / Associated Press) Comments 
BOISE, Idaho (AP) â€” The number of people applying for a concealed weapon permit and buying firearms has doubled this month in a county on the Oregon border. 
The Canyon County Sheriff's Office reports they received 60 first-time concealed weapons permits since Oct. 1, the day of of a mass shooting at an Oregon college. The county is home to the cities of Caldwell and Nampa as well as smaller cities and rural areas. 
KBOI-TV reports an employee at Impact Guns in nearby Boise says that store has experienced an upward trend in pistol and ammunition sales. They also have seen at least 150 new shooters at their range. 
Protection concerns have also increased interest in other self-defense sales, such as pepper spray. 
The Ada County Sheriff's Office says that county, home to Boise, has not seen a rapid increase in concealed carry applications. The office has already issued more than 26,000 active concealed weapons permits. 
-- The Associated Press
